priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Rad/Nuc Agent Ionizing Radiation Type Response Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C158121

self.title: CDISC SEND Rad/Nuc Agent Ionizing Radiation Type Response Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the form of ionizing radiation that is emitted by the rad/nuc agent source.
name: Rad/Nuc Agent Ionizing Radiation Type Response
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Rad/Nuc Agent Ionizing Radiation Type Response Terminology
synonyms: Rad/Nuc Agent Ionizing Radiation Type Response

terms.definition: A positively charged particle ejected spontaneously from the nuclei of some radioactive isotopes. It is a helium nucleus that has a mass number of 4 and an electrostatic charge of +2e. (NTI)
A charged particle (an electron or positron) emitted from a nucleus during certain types of radioactive decay, with a mass much smaller than that of a proton or a neutron. (NTI)
A high-energy, short wavelength (shorter than X-ray), ionizing electromagnetic type of radiation emitted from the nucleus.
A type of ionizing radiation composed of neutrons.
A type of ionizing radiation composed of protons.
A high-energy, short wavelength (longer than gamma ray), ionizing electromagnetic type of radiation emitted from outside the nucleus in the electron shell.
